critique: The document describes the restoration of certain tracts of land within the Big Horn Forest Reservation in Wyoming to the public domain, finding them better suited for agriculture than forestry. This suggests a preference for economic development (agriculture) over environmental preservation (forestry). There is no information about immigration, executive power, security/liberty, or social inclusion. The document does touch on federalism, as it involves a decision made at the federal level (by the President, based on the recommendation of the Secretary of the Interior) regarding land within a state.
